paper.title: Novel MTB-Assisted AnMBR for Treatment of Organic Sulfur Pesticide Wastewater
paper.abstract: This study investigates the application of magnetotactic bacteria (MTB) assisted anaerobic membrane bioreactor (AnMBR) for treating organic sulfur pesticide wastewater. By comparing with conventional AnMBR, the MTB-assisted system demonstrated superior removal efficiency for pollutants including COD, mancozeb, ETU, Mn2+, and Zn2+ under various hydraulic retention times (HRTs). The results showed enhanced methane production and enzyme activities, indicating that MTB integration mitigates toxicity and improves treatment performance, with potential for reducing membrane fouling.
